entry.title: Hong Kong cardinal Joseph Zen arrested under China's security law
entry.summary: Senior Catholic Cardinal Joseph Zen is a long-time critic of the Chinese government.

entry.title: United States passes one million Covid deaths
entry.summary: It's the highest total in the world - but the WHO thinks the true death toll may be higher elsewhere.

entry.title: Families Reel Outside El Salvador Prisons After Gang Violence Crackdowns
entry.summary: Dozens of women wait outside a detention facility for news of their loved ones after a crackdown on gang violence resulted in the imprisonment of more than 25,000 people.

entry.title: Life in a Ukrainian Unit: Diving for Cover, Waiting for Western Weapons
entry.summary: Analysts say the outcome of fighting now is riding on the accuracy, quantity and the striking power of long-range weapons. Ukraine is pleading for more.

entry.title: Biden to Host Southeast Asian Leaders as He Tries to Return Focus to China
entry.summary: The leaders at the two-day summit in Washington will discuss a variety of topics, but the president plans to use it to show a united front again Beijing.

entry.title: These Dancers Escaped the War. Their Journeys Are Just Beginning.
entry.summary: Hundreds of ballet dancers and students fled Ukraine after Russia’s invasion. With opportunities scarce, many will have to keep moving if they want to keep dancing.

entry.title: Finland to apply for Nato membership 'without delay'
entry.summary: Russia has threatened unspecified measures if the country abandons its policy of military non-alignment.

entry.title: North Korea: 'First' Covid cases prompt strict national lockdown
entry.summary: North Korea has rejected any kind of vaccine, with Kim Jong-un now ordering "maximum emergency" controls.

entry.title: U.K. Donor Said to Have Funneled Russian Money to Tories
entry.summary: The cash was part of a fund-raising blitz that helped propel Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s party to victory in 2019. Records track $630,225 to a Russian bank account.

entry.title: Shireen Abu Aqla: UN chief appalled at Al Jazeera reporter's killing
entry.summary: Shireen Abu Aqla was shot dead while covering a raid by Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank.

entry.title: Your Thursday Briefing
entry.summary: Forecasts for the war in Ukraine.

entry.title: The long struggle to return Cambodia's looted treasures
entry.summary: The east Asian country claims the V&A and British Museum both hold stolen antiquities.

entry.title: Has the Milky Way’s Black Hole Come to Light?
entry.summary: The Event Horizon Telescope reaches again for a glimpse of the “unseeable.”

entry.title: Sri Lanka crisis: Gotabaya Rajapaksa speech fails to reassure as crisis grows
entry.summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa again ignored calls to resign amid protests over an economic crisis.

entry.title: Google Translate adds 24 new languages
entry.summary: Ten African languages are among the additions to the US tech giant's interpretation tool.

entry.title: US Democrats' bid for federal abortion law fails in the Senate
entry.summary: A bill to make the right to abortion a national law was expected to fail, but could have political weight.

entry.title: Tom Hiddleston: Why we all need monsters and myths
entry.summary: The Loki star on his thought-provoking role as a Victorian pastor in TV series The Essex Serpent.

entry.title: Gambling worry as India firms bet big on online games
entry.summary: The industry says online gaming involves skill but critics say it is gambling, which is illegal in India.

entry.title: Sri Lanka protests: Why rioters attacked a museum in Sri Lanka
entry.summary: A museum dedicated to the country's ruling family is trashed by anti-government protesters.

entry.title: Ipob: Nigerian 'media warriors' call for killings on social media over Biafra
entry.summary: The BBC investigates a network of Nigerian separatists outside the country urging violence online.

entry.title: The black evangelical women who'll decide who governs Brazil
entry.summary: Evangelical Christian women of colour were kingmakers in Brazil's last presidential election and look set to be so again.

entry.title: 'No idea' passenger lands Florida plane as pilot falls ill
entry.summary: The unnamed passenger can be heard in recordings saying he had "no idea how to stop the airplane".

entry.title: Veteran Al Jazeera Journalist Killed in West Bank
entry.summary: Shireen Abu Akleh was fatally shot while covering an Israeli army raid on the Jenin refugee camp in the West Bank.

entry.title: Passersby in Florida rush to stop moving car with ill driver
entry.summary: The car is seen drifting towards traffic before strangers intervened on a busy road in Florida.

entry.title: Ukraine Launches First War Crimes Trial for Russian Soldier
entry.summary: A 21-year-old Russian soldier is accused of following orders to shoot an unarmed cyclist four days into Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

entry.title: North Carolina: The moment a beach house collapsed into the sea
entry.summary: The stilts holding up the house gave way after being struck by high winds and strong tides.

entry.title: Your Thursday Briefing: A Journalist Killed in the West Bank
entry.summary: Plus uncertainty about China’s wheat harvest and religious violence in India.

entry.title: Ukraine war: Don’t underestimate Russia cyber-threat, warns US
entry.summary: A senior intelligence official says a cyber-war raging over Ukraine could escalate further.

entry.title: Quentin Sommerville: BBC on patrol with the soldiers pushing Russia back
entry.summary: The BBC's Quentin Sommerville spends a week with Ukrainians liberating towns north of Kharkiv.

entry.title: Covid mask rules relaxed for EU air travel
entry.summary: Masks will no longer have to be worn on EU flights and in airports from next Monday, new guidance says.

entry.title: Joly Germine: Haitian gang leader indicted over missionary abductions
entry.summary: Joly Germine allegedly directed the kidnappings of 17 Christian missionaries from a Haitian prison.

entry.title: Ukraine war: Snake Island and battle for control in Black Sea
entry.summary: This rocky outcrop has been fiercely contested for weeks and has vital strategic importance.

entry.title: US price rises ease for the first time in months
entry.summary: The prices of clothing and used cars fell, but inflation remains at a 40-year high.

entry.title: Eurovision 2022: Emotions run high as Ukraine's Kalush Orchestra qualify for final
entry.summary: Ukrainian fans celebrated in Turin as the Kalush Orchestra cement their position as favourites to win.

entry.title: Are Sweden and Finland going from neutral to Nato?
entry.summary: It would be a historic shift if they do and Russia is vehemently opposed to the change.

entry.title: Grenada: Confronting my family’s slave-owning past
entry.summary: The BBC's Laura Trevelyan travels to the island of Grenada to investigate her family's slave-owning past.

entry.title: Archive sheds new light on Tutankhamun discovery, 100 years on
entry.summary: An exhibition in Oxford tells how Howard Carter's team excavated the pharaoh's tomb 100 years ago.

entry.title: ‘If I die no-one will know’: Covid and Hong Kong’s 'cage men'
entry.summary: The Omicron variant overwhelmed the city's healthcare system resulting in many deaths.
